gitCommands.name: Initialize Repository
gitCommands.description: Initialize a new Git repository in the current or specified directory.

gitCommands.name: Clone Repository
gitCommands.description: Clone an existing Git repository to a new directory on the local machine.

gitCommands.name: Add Files
gitCommands.description: Add files to the Git staging area, ready for a commit.

gitCommands.name: Commit Changes
gitCommands.description: Save changes made to the Git repository to the history with a specified commit message.

gitCommands.name: Push Changes
gitCommands.description: Push committed changes to a remote repository.

gitCommands.name: Pull Changes
gitCommands.description: Retrieve changes from a remote repository and merge them with the local repository.

gitCommands.name: Check Status
gitCommands.description: Check the status of the Git repository and view changes that haven't been committed yet.

gitCommands.name: View Commit History
gitCommands.description: View the history of commits in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Create a Branch
gitCommands.description: Create a new branch in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Switch to a Branch
gitCommands.description: Switch to a different branch in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Compare Branches
gitCommands.description: Compare the differences between two branches in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Merge Branches
gitCommands.description: Merge changes from a specified branch into the current branch in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Rename a Branch
gitCommands.description: Rename the current branch in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Delete a Branch
gitCommands.description: Delete a branch in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Reset Changes
gitCommands.description: Reset changes made to a file in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Undo Commit
gitCommands.description: Undo a specific commit in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Tag a Commit
gitCommands.description: Add a tag to a specific commit in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Stash Changes
gitCommands.description: Temporarily save changes made to the Git repository without committing them.

gitCommands.name: Apply Stashed Changes
gitCommands.description: Apply changes that were stashed in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: List Stashed Changes
gitCommands.description: List all stashed changes in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Remove Stashed Changes
gitCommands.description: Remove stashed changes from the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Show Commit Log
gitCommands.description: Display the commit history of the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Show Commit Differences
gitCommands.description: Show the differences of a specific commit in the Git repository.

gitCommands.name: Fetch Remote Changes
gitCommands.description: Fetch updates from a remote repository to the local repository.

gitCommands.name: Pull Remote Changes
gitCommands.description: Fetch and merge updates from a remote repository to the local repository.

gitCommands.name: Push Local Changes
gitCommands.description: Push local changes to a remote repository.

gitCommands.name: Add Remote Repository
gitCommands.description: Add a remote repository to the local repository.

gitCommands.name: Remove Remote Repository
gitCommands.description: Remove a remote repository from the local repository.

gitCommands.name: Show Remote Repositories
gitCommands.description: Show information about a remote repository in the local repository.
